title: Ticket #402: condor_install not equivalent to "condor_configure --install"
description:
The manual claims of condor_configure, "--install - Perform installation, assuming that the current working directory contains the release directories. Without further options, the configuration is that of a Personal Condor, a complete one-machine pool. If used as an upgrade within an existing installation directory, existing configuration files and local directory are preserved. This is the default behavior of condor_install."

Given this, I expect that a naked "condor_install" is equivalent to "condor_configure --install" and should create "a complete one-machine pool." Instead: 

% ./condor_install
usage: condor_install [options]
    --install[=<path/to/release_dirs>]
    --prefix=<path>
    --install-dir=<path>
    --local-dir=<path>
    --make-personal-condor
    --make-personal-stork
    --type=<[submit],[execute],[manager]>
    --central-manager=<host>
    --stork
    --credd
    --owner=<user>
    --maybe-daemon-owner
    --install-log=<file>
    --overwrite
    --env-scripts-dir= dir
    --no-env-scripts
    --ignore-missing-libs
    --force
    --backup
    --verbose
    --usage
    --help

"condor_configure --install" works as expected. 

% ./condor_configure --install
Setting up Condor in /scratch/adesmet/722-prio-test/condor-7.2.2

Condor has been installed into:
    /scratch/adesmet/722-prio-test/condor-7.2.2

In order for Condor to work properly you must set your CONDOR_CONFIG
environment variable to point to your Condor configuration file:
/scratch/adesmet/722-prio-test/condor-7.2.2/etc/condor_config before
running Condor commands/daemons.
Created scripts which can be sourced by users to setup their
Condor environment variables.  These are:
   sh: /scratch/adesmet/722-prio-test/condor-7.2.2/condor.sh
  csh: /scratch/adesmet/722-prio-test/condor-7.2.2/condor.csh
remarks:
2009-Jun-16 15:32:44 by adesmet:
"condor_install --help" makes similarly false claims:

    --install[=<path/to/release_dirs>] Perform installation of Condor files and initial configuration as a working personal Condor. (if type or "central manager" are not specified). If this is an upgrade to an existing installation directory, the existing config files and local directory will be preserved. The default behavior of "condor_install" is "--install=.".
